Welcome to giotto-deep’s documentation!¶

Indices and tables¶

class gdeep.create_nets.CircleNN¶

Generates a neural network that is proportional to a Gaussian Kernel in 2D

forward(x_cont)¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

class gdeep.create_nets.DeeperNN(dropout_p=0.0)¶

This functions creates a deeper neural network with four fully connected layers of dimensions 2 - 16 - 32 -64 - 2.

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

class gdeep.create_nets.Net(verbose=0, arch=[2, 3, 3])¶

This is the custom network that is easily built from an array, in which the number and dimensions of the layers is specified. (from Matteo)

forward(x_cat, x_cont)¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

class gdeep.create_nets.PeriodicNeuralNetworkMaker(nn: torch.nn.modules.module.Module, boundary_list)¶

Makes a periodic nn.Module of nn. boundary_list specifies the elementary region the periodic neural network is supported on. This creates neural networks factorized by the orbits of a group effect, which is given by reflection at the edges of the elementary domain. This class can be interpreted as an adapter for periodic neural networks.

forward(x_cont)¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

class gdeep.create_nets.SimpleNN(nodes_layer_1=8, dropout_p=0.0)¶

This functions creates a simple neural network with three fully connected layers of dimensions 2 - 10 - 2.

class gdeep.create_nets.ToFastaiNN(nn: torch.nn.modules.module.Module)¶

Adapter for Fastai nn.Module. The syntax of the forward methode of the input is (x_cat: torch.tensor)->torch.tensor and the syntax of the forward function for the output is (x_cat: torch.tensor, x_cont: torch.tensor)->torch.tensor.

forward(x_cat, x_cont)¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

class gdeep.create_nets.ToPyTorchNN(nn: torch.nn.modules.module.Module)¶

Adapter for Fastai nn.Module. The syntax of the forward methode of the input is (x_cat: torch.tensor, x_cont: torch.tensor)->torch.tensor and the syntax of the forward function for the output is (x_cat: torch.tensor)->torch.tensor.

forward(x_cont)¶

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

gdeep.create_nets.get_activations(model, X_tensor, layer_types=[<class 'torch.nn.modules.linear.Linear'>])¶

Returns activation of layers

Args:

model ([type]): [description] X_tensor ([type]): [description] layer_types (list, optional): [description]. Defaults to [torch.nn.Linear].

Returns:

[type]: [description]

gdeep.create_nets.train_classification_nn(nn, X, y, lr=0.001, n_epochs=100, bs=32)¶

Train a neural network on a classifiction task

  • nn (nn.Module): [description]

  • X 2darray: [description]

  • y 1darray: [description]

  • lr (float, optional): [description]. Defaults to 0.001.

  • epochs (int, optional): [description]. Defaults to 100.

  • bs (int): batch size

  • fastai tabular learner

gdeep.create_data.make_torus_dataset(entangled: bool = True) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Generates pandas Dataframe of two tori in 3D. The labels correspond to the different Tori.

Args:

entangled (bool, optional): Either entangled or unentangled tori. Defaults to True.

Returns:

pd.core.frame.DataFrame: pandas dataframe with columns x1, x2, x3, label.

gdeep.create_data.make_torus_point_cloud(label: int, n_points: int, noise: float, rotation: gdeep.create_data.tori.Rotation, base_point: numpy.array, radius: float = 1.0)¶

Generate point cloud of a torus

Args:

label (int): label of the data points n_points (int): number of sample points for each direction noise (float): noise rotation: Rotation base_point (np.array): center of the torus radius: float

Returns:

(np.array, np.array): data_points, labels

class gdeep.decision_boundary.DecisionBoundaryCalculator¶

Abstract class for calculating the decision boundary of a neural network

abstract get_decision_boundary() → torch.Tensor¶

Return current state and does not make a step

Returns:

torch.tensor: current estimate of the decision boundary

abstract step(number_of_steps=1)¶

Performs a single step towards the decision boundary

class gdeep.decision_boundary.GradientFlow(neural_net: torch.nn.modules.module.Module, boundary_tuple: list, n_samples: int = 10000, epsilon: float = 0.01, n_epochs: int = 30)¶

Computes a the decision boundary of a neural network using gradient flow

Args:
neural_net (nn.Module): neural network trained on a binary

classification task

boundary_tuple (list): List of boundary of interval where points are sampled from n_samples (int, optional): Number of sample points. Defaults to 1000. n_epochs (int, optional): Number of epochs for the gradient flow. Defaults to 30.

class gdeep.decision_boundary.GradientFlowDecisionBoundaryCalculator(model: Callable[[torch.Tensor], torch.Tensor], initial_points: torch.Tensor, optimizer: Callable[[torch.Tensor], torch.optim.optimizer.Optimizer])¶

Computes Decision Boundary using the gradient flow method

get_decision_boundary() → torch.Tensor¶

Return current state and does not make a step

Returns:

torch.tensor: current estimate of the decision boundary

step(number_of_steps=1)¶

Performs the indicated number of steps towards the decision boundary

class gdeep.decision_boundary.UniformlySampledPoint(tuple_list: list, n_samples: int = 1000)¶

get_dim()¶

gdeep.plotting.persistence_diagrams_of_activations(model, X, layer_types=[<class 'torch.nn.modules.linear.Linear'>], homology_dimensions=[0, 1], layers=<gdeep.create_nets.utility.Layers_list object>)¶

Returns list of persistence diagrams of the activations of all layers of type layer_types

Args:

model (nn.Module): Neural Network X 2darray: [description] layer_types (list, optional): [description]. Defaults to [torch.nn.Linear]. homology_dimensions (list, optional): list of homology dimensions. Defaults to [0, 1]. layers ([type], optional): list of layer types to consider. Defaults to Layers_list(‘All’).

Returns:

list: list of persistence diagrams of activations of the different layers

  • X 2darray: [description]
